wordageddon.model

Class DocumentTermMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • wordageddon.model.DocumentTermMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DocumentTermMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Document-Term Matrix implementation for text analysis. Stores word frequencies across multiple documents using nested HashMaps. Supports serialization for data persistence over multiple gameplay sessions.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gregorio Barberio, Francesco Peluso, Davide Quaranta, Ciro Ronca
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      DocumentTermMatrix()
      Constructs a new empty Document-Term Matrix.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocumentTermMatrix

        public DocumentTermMatrix()
        Constructs a new empty Document-Term Matrix. Initializes the internal HashMap structure.

    • Method Detail

      • addTerm

        public void addTerm(java.lang.String documentId,
                    java.lang.String word)
        Adds a term to the specified document and increments its frequency count. If the document doesn't exist in the matrix, it creates a new entry. If the term doesn't exist for the document, it initializes the count to 1.
        Parameters:
        documentId - the unique identifier of the document
        word - the term/word to add to the document

      • getAllTerms

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllTerms()
        Retrieves all unique terms across all documents in the matrix. The terms are returned in a lexicographically ordered set.
        Returns:
        a TreeSet containing all unique terms found in any document

      • getTermsForDocument

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getTermsForDocument(java.lang.String documentId)
        Retrieves all terms and their frequencies for a specific document.
        Parameters:
        documentId - the unique identifier of the document
        Returns:
        a Map containing all terms and their frequencies for the document, or an empty map if the document doesn't exist

      • getFrequency

        public int getFrequency(java.lang.String documentId,
                        java.lang.String word)
        Retrieves the frequency of a specific term in a given document.
        Parameters:
        documentId - the unique identifier of the document
        word - the term to look up
        Returns:
        the frequency of the term in the document, or 0 if not found

      • getDocuments

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getDocuments()
        Retrieves all document identifiers stored in the matrix.
        Returns:
        a Set containing all document identifiers

      • getVocabularySize

        public int getVocabularySize()
        Gets the size of the vocabulary (total number of unique terms).
        Returns:
        the number of unique terms across all documents

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile(java.io.File file)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the Document-Term Matrix to a file using Java serialization.
        Parameters:
        file - the File object representing where the matrix should be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during saving

      • loadFromFile

        public static DocumentTermMatrix loadFromFile(java.io.File file)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads a Document-Term Matrix from a file using Java deserialization.
        Parameters:
        file - the File object representing the file to load from
        Returns:
        the loaded DocumentTermMatrix instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs during loading
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the file doesn't contain a valid DocumentTermMatrix

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test method to demonstrate the functionality of the DocumentTermMatrix class. Creates sample data, saves it to file, and loads it back to verify serialization.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments (not used)
